radiographic_examinations.findings: Abnormalities in the lower lobe of the left lung.
Moderate pericardial effusion, prominent pulmonary arteries, and scarring in the lower lobe of the right lung.
Mild-to-moderate pericardial effusion, thickening of the left ventricular walls, enlarged right atrium and right ventricle, and mild tricuspid-valve regurgitation.
Enlargement of the right, left, and main pulmonary arteries.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Confirmed enlargement of the main pulmonary artery and no evidence of pulmonary emboli on subsequent studies.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Enlarged main pulmonary artery, hypertrophy of right ventricular wall, and reflux of contrast into the inferior vena cava and hepatic veins.
